content:
Diagnosis:		Clear cell carcinoma of ovary, Stage IC3

Management:		Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy 15 March 2024

Histology:		Clear cell carcinoma of right ovary
		Rupture during surgery
		ARID1A mutation detected
		Stage IC3

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 1 adjuvant carboplatin/paclitaxel

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the gynae-oncology clinic. She has recovered well from her surgery with good wound healing and minimal residual pain. Her performance status is 0 and she remains physically active. Blood results show normal renal function with creatinine clearance 85ml/min, normal liver function, and adequate bone marrow reserve with hemoglobin 118g/L, neutrophils 3.8, platelets 285.

I have discussed adjuvant chemotherapy with carboplatin AUC5 and paclitaxel 175mg/m2 every 3 weeks for 6 cycles. We reviewed common and serious side effects, and I have provided written information. She understands to contact us with any concerns. I have prescribed cycle 1 to commence next week and arranged follow-up prior to cycle 2.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Clear cell carcinoma with rupture during surgery

cancer_timeline.value: Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy
ARID1A mutation detected in surgical specimen
Planning to commence carboplatin AUC5 and paclitaxel 175mg/m2 adjuvant chemotherapy

patient_facts.value: Normal renal function with creatinine clearance 85ml/min, normal liver function, hemoglobin 118g/L, neutrophils 3.8, platelets 285

status_updates.value: Recently diagnosed clear cell ovarian cancer post-surgery. Recovered well and planned for adjuvant chemotherapy
To commence adjuvant carboplatin AUC5 and paclitaxel 175mg/m2 every 3 weeks for 6 cycles
